column4: is there any way to bypass the ubuntu logon screen, so it boots straight into gnome?
You could configure it to login automatically.
Have you tried repartitioning it? (With 'gparted' or 'parted' or 'cfdisk')
gparted just formats it back to 16gb
You tried completely deleting all partitions and recreating them?
Ah, in that case I really doubt there is any "low-level format" tool. They usually don't exist for flash-based drives.
i know there is a windows tool to do it
You could try 'dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sdc bs=1024' or something (replace /dev/sdc with your flashdrive), that would completely blank everything that Linux can write to.
it can write to the fake sectors
But, I have a feeling this was done by reprogramming the chip inside...
(Btw, I know someone who bought a "Made in China" 16 GB pendrive, and it turned out to be 1 _kilo_byte.)
Would you happen to have the Windows program available for download? (I'm interested)
